content.protection: 6? Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Ascends what could probably be called a blunt arete that separates the Lair wall from the Main wall of the Maximum.   The start is a very obvious glue in bolt directly in a cobble about 8' off the ground.

content.description:
We had a difference of opinion on the grade of this climb and its relative difficulty compared to

Thwarted

to the right, so we just called them both 9+.  You decide!   Morning sun.   Either stick clip and pull a move off the ground or start on the route to the right (with an obvious low bolt in direcltly  a cobble) and traverse left to to get the first bolt of

Murphy

.
content.protection: 6? Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Just left of the very blunt arete, and right of the Lair cave.   The first bolt is pretty high and must be stick clipped or you can start on the low bolt of the route to the right and traverse in.

content.description: Comes out the lip of the Lair roof and ascends some mildly overhanging terrain to anchors just out of sight.   Maybe a little soft at 11c?   Sun most of the day.  Definitely needs to be stick clipped (at least the first bolt, or safer yet the first two).
content.protection: 6? Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners.  Bring a few extra just in case.
content.location: Furthest left route coming out of the Lair cave.  High first bolt that needs to be stick clipped.

content.description: Avoids the worst part of the cave start, but still punchy off the ground before settling into better holds above.   Anchors are just out of sight in the easier terrain above.   Sun most of the day.  Stick clip!
content.protection: 5? Stainless bolts, chains with steel biners
content.location: Comes out of the right side of the Lair roof.   2nd route from left.
